confession.seduction_context: She had quarrelled with her daughter-in-law who drove her from the house. She was sleeping in the woods at night when Persy found her and promised to help her. Met her again 2 weeks later on the way to seek alms at Guermange.
powder_types: powder (given by Persy, but she claimed to have thrown it away initially)
powder (later confessed to using it to kill horses)
sabbat_activities: ate black soup and black, burned meat

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused had been working for his wife and asked for 'eschaude' (a type of pastry/bread) that wife forgot to give her

witnesses.name: Thiebault Thiebault dit Patticier
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor (came from Sercoeur about 20 years before)

testimony.quarrel_subject: As messier, caught her son stealing beans and took caution to officer; she came angrily demanding its return
testimony.threat_quote: mon enffant ne voudrois tu pas bien estre mort

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: next day fell ill, died day after

testimony.quarrel_subject: Many quarrels; accused cursing and damning her repeatedly
testimony.threat_quote: qu'il y en avoit desté qu'avoient eus le col rompu, et qu'il y en auroit encor d'aultres

harms_alleged.attributed_to: Collatte Lorette and her late husband
harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: after quarrel when they lived at Sercoeur

witnesses.name: Noel Perrin
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: bought property from her; lived in same house

testimony.quarrel_subject: Accused complained they had bought her property cheaply while she was in Allemaigne
General quarrelsomeness; wanted to have upper hand everywhere

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: during illness horse went blind and died in 3 days

harms_alleged.attributed_to: Collatte Lorette (suggested by wife of Noel Perrin)

harms_alleged.target: wife of late Didier Bretton (la Valentré)

testimony.quarrel_subject: Arguing at an 'escraigne'; husband had quarrelled with her when working as salpetrier, and she claimed he had wronged her

witnesses.name: George Hillaire, gentilhomme dit de la Grange

timeline.subject: Collatte Lorette
timeline.details: PG de Lorraine (C.M. Rémy) orders investigation into her reputation following remonstrance from Noel Perrin

timeline.subject: Collatte Lorette
timeline.details: First interrogation; she denies being a witch but admits taking fruit, dead wood, and some logs

timeline.subject: Collatte Lorette
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses; she calls Thiebault Thiebault a murderer and liar

timeline.subject: Collatte Lorette
timeline.details: PG asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Collatte Lorette
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture; withstood thumbscrews and rack, then confessed after being released

timeline.subject: Collatte Lorette
timeline.details: Confirmed and expanded confession; admitted attending sabbat twice and using powder to kill horses

timeline.subject: Collatte Lorette
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves death sentence

timeline.subject: Collatte Lorette and la Vilaume
timeline.details: Confronted with la Vilaume after naming her as accomplice

timeline.subject: Collatte Lorette
timeline.details: Formal death sentence from court at Amance

accomplices_named.name: la Vilaume
accomplices_named.context: Saw her on way home from sabbat; did not recognize at sabbat but saw afterwards

accomplices_named.name: Mengeotte of Verhange
accomplices_named.context: Saw her on way home from sabbat; did not recognize at sabbat but saw afterwards

notable_quotes.speaker: Collatte Lorette (to child in cradle)
notable_quotes.french: mon enffant ne voudrois tu pas bien estre mort
notable_quotes.english: my child, would you not like to be dead
notable_quotes.context: Spoken when she lifted the linen of the baby in the cradle during quarrel with Thiebault Thiebault

notable_quotes.speaker: Marguerite femme Thiebault
notable_quotes.french: qu'il y en avoit desté qu'avoient eus le col rompu, et qu'il y en auroit encor d'aultres
notable_quotes.english: there were some who had their necks broken, and there would be others
notable_quotes.context: Threatening words recalled by Marguerite; accused would say this during quarrels

notable_quotes.speaker: Thiebault Thiebault to accused
notable_quotes.french: Jeunot, sorcier il te fault brusler
notable_quotes.english: Jeunot, witch you must be burned
notable_quotes.context: During confrontation when describing beating her in the street

notable_quotes.speaker: Collatte Lorette in response
notable_quotes.french: ne la vouloir maintenir femme de bien que selon les chansons qu'elle chantera elle luy respondra, disant arrogamment que les clercs ne scauroient chanter s'ilz ne scavent pleinement leurs charges
notable_quotes.english: she would not maintain herself as a good woman except according to the songs they sing, she will respond, saying arrogantly that the clerks cannot sing if they do not fully know their charges

notable_quotes.speaker: Barbe femme Simon Bretton
notable_quotes.french: fort mal plaisante, et qu'elle se scavoit bien revanchée
notable_quotes.english: very unpleasant, and that she knew well how to take revenge

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Remy's response to accused
notable_quotes.french: qu'elle se prenoit et querelloit a ung chacun, qu'elle vouloit avoir le hault bras partout
notable_quotes.english: that she picked quarrels with everyone, that she wanted to have the upper hand everywhere
notable_quotes.context: When accused complained about being called witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Collatte Lorette
notable_quotes.french: nous sommes tous subjects a fortunes ne scachant quant ny comment
notable_quotes.english: we are all subject to misfortunes, not knowing when or how
notable_quotes.context: During interrogation about death of Nicolas Remy's horse

notable_quotes.speaker: Collatte Lorette to Nicolas Lyenal
notable_quotes.french: Bien mon fils sy tu viens a chef croistre, et que tu fusse devestu comme le mien
notable_quotes.english: Well my son if you come to grow up, and you were stripped like mine
notable_quotes.context: Her version of what she said to the baby (different from witness account)

notable_quotes.speaker: Françoise femme Nicolas Lyenal about threat
notable_quotes.context: Threat made at an 'escraigne' to her husband

relationships.evidence_text: left to live with her son in Allemaigne; had given power to son to settle affairs
Had quarrelled with daughter-in-law, who finally drove her from house
5 years earlier 2 of his father's horses died; Nicolas Remy is son
Had come from Sercoeur about 20 years before, and become his neighbour
Perrin bought house from her and late husband; lived in same house; business dispute
late Didier Bretton claim she had caused death of his wife, la Valentré

economic_context.details: Collatte had left to live with son in Allemaigne because of bad reputation. She had given power to son to settle affairs, and he made deal with Noel Perrin to sell goods and over usufruit of room in house Perrin bought from her and late husband. She was constantly molesting Perrin with lawsuits over this arrangement. She also complained that Nicolas Remy and his wife had bought her property cheaply while she was away in Allemaigne. The accused admitted to stealing fruit, dead wood, logs, and utensils when poor. Multiple witnesses described her as a thief who stole from gardens and hedges.

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused had been working for his wife and asked for 'eschaude' she forgot to give her
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: around same time (5 or 6 years before trial)

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel with la Grande Valentré, told her she would repent
Caught her son stealing beans as messier; she came angrily demanding return of caution
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: next day child fell ill, died day after

harms_catalog.victim_name: Seven subsequent children of Thiebault Thiebault
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Ongoing quarrels with wife, cursing and damning her

harms_catalog.harm_description: fell from a tree and was killed
harms_catalog.attributed_to: Collatte Lorette and her late husband
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrels with uncle when they lived at Sercoeur
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after quarrels (when both reputed witches at Sercoeur)

harms_catalog.victim_name: Horse belonging to Nicolas Remy's household
harms_catalog.harm_description: suddenly gone blind and died in 3 days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused complained they had bought her property cheaply
harms_catalog.method_alleged: proximity - came to house asking for water twice during illness

harms_catalog.victim_name: 2 horses belonging to Nicolas Remy's father
Horse bought at Brin by Nicolas Remy
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Gave her 'denier dieu' for horse after forgetting to give it at purchase; she said it had been hasty to say she killed father's horses

harms_catalog.victim_name: Horse belonging to late Nicolas Hugues
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: He spoke harshly to her when she begged for alms
He spoke harshly to her when he met her on road

material_culture.context: Type of pastry/bread that witness's wife forgot to give accused, leading to quarrel
Accused's son caught stealing beans by messier Thiebault Thiebault
Child in cradle when accused looked at it and lifted linen, speaking threatening words
Accused met in street with apron full of beans
Accused stole utensils when living in same house as Noel Perrin
Accused stole logs from behind Simon Bretton's house; later begged mercy and returned some
Accused often seen taking dead wood from hedges and gardens
Traditional coin given for luck when buying horse; Nicolas Remy gave it to accused
Accused threatened Nicolas Lyenal with her husband's halbard to make him leave
Thiebault Thiebault beat accused with stone in her 'poisle' (room/chamber)
Devil (Persy) gave her powder twice on way from la Neuflotte; she claimed to have thrown it away initially, then confessed to using it to kill horses
Money given by devil near Languebert proved to be oak leaves
7 or 8 other witches at sabbat were masked

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial; where accused lived before going to Allemaigne
Where Thiebault Thiebault came from 20 years before; where accused and late husband lived and were both reputed witches
Where accused went to live with son; region/territory
Village on border of Allemaigne where accused was living with son when seduced by devil
Where accused was going to seek alms when devil met her again
Near where devil gave her money that proved to be oak leaves
Where feast was held at St Laurent; accused was begging there
Devil met her on way from here and gave her powder twice
Location of sabbat; where witches were said to meet
Where Nicolas Remy bought a horse
Location of court; Remy Dieudonné was former mayor and alderman there
Where accused was sleeping at night when devil Persy found her and promised to help

economic_hardship_indicators: accused left village due to bad reputation
accused begging for alms at multiple villages (Guermange, Sercourt)
accused stealing food (beans, fruit), dead wood, logs, utensils

prior_legal_disputes.description: Multiple lawsuits between accused and Noel Perrin over property sale and usufruit of room in house
Lawsuits between accused and Thiebault Thiebault over quarrels; cost her money

hearsay_chains.content: Wife said during fatal illness that it was accused's witchcraft; wife claimed la Grande Valentré said death was witchcraft by accused
Le grand Thiebault had called her witch and accused her of causing death of child
Had heard of suspicions by le Grand Thiebault, and of accusations she had killed la grande Valentré
Had several times heard late Didier Bretton claim she had caused death of his wife, la Valentré
Perrin's wife suggested to accused that Nicolas thought she had killed his father's horses

emotional_state_notes: withstood torture saying she would not confess even if drawn by 4 horses

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Said Thiebault Thiebault was a murderer who had beaten her with a stone in her poisle, and 'un faussaire'; accused him of beating her son naked when taking caution
Said that Noel Perrin was thief and murderer, but had no witness to this

third_parties.name: la Grande Valentré
third_parties.context: Died after quarrel with accused; multiple witnesses reported this; wife of late Didier Bretton

third_parties.name: Didier Bretton
third_parties.context: Late husband of la Valentré; claimed accused caused death of his wife

third_parties.name: Chrespaille le Barry
third_parties.context: Fell from tree and was killed after quarreling with accused and her husband at Sercoeur

third_parties.name: son of accused (unnamed)
third_parties.context: Living in Allemaigne; accused went to live with him; given power to settle affairs; caught stealing beans as child

third_parties.name: daughter-in-law of accused (at Rodde)
third_parties.context: Quarreled with accused and drove her from house at Rodde

third_parties.name: son-in-law of accused
third_parties.context: Was absent and could not give attestation about power to settle affairs

third_parties.name: Cesar Lorette
third_parties.context: Accused was widow for 8 years; both reputed witches at Sercoeur; quarreled with Chrespaille le Barry

third_parties.name: late Nicolas Hugues
third_parties.context: Horse killed by accused using powder; had spoken harshly to her when she begged for alms

third_parties.name: Persy (devil)
third_parties.context: Devil who seduced accused; found her sleeping in woods, gave her money (oak leaves), had intercourse, gave powder, took her to sabbat

third_parties.name: wife of Noel Perrin
third_parties.context: Was annoyed about 'denier dieu' given to accused; suggested to accused that Nicolas Remy thought she killed his father's horses

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete 5-page trial document with detailed witness testimonies, interrogations, confrontations, torture session, confession, and sentencing. Rich detail on economic disputes, property conflicts, theft accusations, and social tensions. Confession obtained after torture includes sabbat attendance and maleficia. Multiple allegations of child deaths and animal deaths. Strong pattern of quarrels followed by harms. Accused showed defiant behavior during confrontations.
